{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3500134,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T20:39:57.788Z","cooked":"

I found it interesting that the robot weight limit changed to 115 lb this year – in Team Update 0, no less (as opposed to the “original” robot rules). Of course, every year the robot weight and dimensions are part of the engineering challenge and subject to change, but changes to this specific parameter were very rare in FRC history.
5 or 6 years ago, the weight limit was bumped from 120lb to 125lb, but this coincided with a new rule that the compressor for pneumatics was required to remain on-board rather than allowing off-board pressure fills. Maybe that wasn’t the exact driver of the weight change, but it made sense.
Did anything in the 2025 season directly drive the 10 lb weight drop, other than making it an additional challenge for teams to accomplish? At first I figured bumper rules may have something to do with it, but expected this would drive rules about total robot field weight as opposed to bumperless weight.
I can certainly say that the 115lb weight limit has added an additional level of design scrutiny for my team this year given the potential size and features we are adding. This is definitely a positive, and also leading to implementation of more exotic materials. Just curious if there was a justification that drove this change in a Team Update.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T20:39:57.788Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1271,"reads":1354,"readers_count":1353,"score":6815.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/poll-115lb-limit-how-concerned-are-you/485152","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"[Poll] 115lb limit: How concerned are you?","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3500149,"name":"Graham Howard","username":"grahamsh","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/grahamsh/{size}/188294_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T20:47:52.665Z","cooked":"

Team Update 0 is the “original” robot rules. It’s the list of changes from previously evergreen rules.

I think it was to keep the field elements more intact. Considering robots have become faster with cots swerve, its kinda to avoid 140 pound bowling balls from destroying the field at comps.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T20:50:46.200Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":1289,"readers_count":1288,"score":582.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Raul","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":21}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51720,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3970 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/3","custom_user_title":"3970 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":18},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":21,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500152,"name":"Peter Clausen","username":"petedog07","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/petedog07/{size}/199760_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T20:50:01.215Z","cooked":"

there’s a multitude of reasons why, one thing that has been changing recently in the past 2 years is trying to reduce collisions and with all the new bumper changes, this could be another way of aiding in robot safety. reducing the weight, and propulsion will certainly lower the impact of robot to robot collisions or robot to field collisions. with many talk from people all over first, field collisions is a major talking point with how powerful robots are getting. Less weight, less mass to throw around.

Also there’s an engineering problem when it comes to weight, optimizing what you can fit within this 115 lbs might be a struggle, but it isn’t an FRC game without a size/weight restriction to make your designers have a headache, but it makes it interesting

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T20:50:01.215Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1268,"readers_count":1267,"score":298.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Peter Clausen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59141,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4786"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/4","custom_user_title":"4786","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500155,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T20:52:09.733Z","cooked":"

My $.02?
With a new max weight of the bumpers being 5 lbs. heavier that in previous years, keeping the total robot weight the same required the new robot weight limit to be reduced by that same 5 lbs.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T20:52:09.733Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":1180,"readers_count":1179,"score":360.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"billbo911","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/5","custom_user_title":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842","reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500194,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T21:47:54.410Z","cooked":"
seg9585:

This is definitely a positive, and also leading to implementation of more exotic materials

This is not a positive for the financially strapped teams. It allows teams with more funding to use stuff like carbon fiber and the new 3d printable material Tullimer. Light weighting aluminum tubing helps but in our case the only way we can do it is to have a mentor use his personal cnc. The new material that REV released doesn’t cut well on a cnc and is aimed at laser cutters which we do not have access to.

I do think the main purpose was to reduce field and robot damage. It has the side benefit of making it easier for the students to load the robot on and off the field.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T21:47:54.410Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":1119,"readers_count":1118,"score":488.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":14}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/6","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500205,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T22:10:39.308Z","cooked":"

I speculate that FIRST tries to follow the OSHA rule that the weight limit of 2 people to lift is 150lbs. EDIT: I looked after I said that, and I can’t find where I heard OSHA has a weight limit. OSHA doesn’t have an official weight limit. See https://www.osha.gov/laws-regs/standardinterpretations/2004-03-29-1

They wanted to raise the bumper weight limit to make bumpers easier, plus 15 lbs for a battery, so 150 -15 -20 left them down to 115 lb robot weight.

I was going to say, maybe they can raise the weight limit to 135, and just combine the robot/bumper weight, but they might want a minimum weight budget to make sure you put enough protection. I could see teams trying the flimsiest backing material to save weight on bumpers to try to make a heavier robot with that rule change.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T22:18:09.015Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":994,"readers_count":993,"score":233.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Steven Carmain","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.osha.gov/laws-regs/standardinterpretations/2004-03-29-1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1737,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer/Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/7","custom_user_title":"Programmer/Drive Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500210,"name":"Pizzatc","username":"Pizzatc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pizzatc/{size}/207342_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T22:21:57.697Z","cooked":"

It comes down to forces and kinetic energy and those two being the primary factors in field damage

F = ma

KE = 1/2mv^2

It wasn’t practical for FIRST to enforce a speed limit so the best they could do is reduce mass so that the fields have less force and energy to endure

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T06:17:16.284Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":908,"readers_count":907,"score":251.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Pizzatc","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54022,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2659"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/8","custom_user_title":"2659","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500215,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T22:33:12.059Z","cooked":"
Steven_Carmain:

I was going to say, maybe they can raise the weight limit to 135, and just combine the robot/bumper weight, but they might want a minimum weight budget to make sure you put enough protection.

And you did see that there’s a combined maximum robot and bumper weight, yes? And a maximum robot weight, but no defined maximum bumper weight?

I trust you see the implications of this arrangement.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T22:35:42.789Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":808,"readers_count":807,"score":356.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":13}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500246,"name":"bradley levesque","username":"snow02","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/snow02/{size}/191758_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T23:08:21.998Z","cooked":"

Set a precedent for future years, lower weight helps reduce damage in high speed full field games, (overdrive v2 next year?) and it increases the engineering challenge,

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T23:08:34.001Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":767,"readers_count":766,"score":163.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"bradley levesque","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54745,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 2200"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor 2200","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500315,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T00:46:15.737Z","cooked":"

Adding to this, in older years with brushed motors, moving 125 pounds of robot quickly meant big gearboxes on almost every system. Drivetrains had very harsh speed vs torque tradeoffs which forced shifting+pnuematics+compressor, and at the end was pulling in 3 motor gearboxes per side to win pushing matches.

Getting the little 550 class motors geared down from 11000+RPM and zero-torque to a more sane combination also required some amount of stepping down and fixturing.

This gearing is now largely obsoleted by “shove a 1/2 hex shaft through the brushless motor” which nets an excess of speed and power for most bot functions. A lot of gearing is also now simplified with low-weight planetary gearboxes, rather than bulky external boxes.

Simply put, the original weight allocation accounted for things that are increasingly less relevant and common, so a re-balance makes sense.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T00:46:15.737Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":718,"readers_count":717,"score":493.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":20}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/12","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":17},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":20,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500333,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T01:19:42.153Z","cooked":"
Thor5090:

It allows teams with more funding

This adds a bit to the disadvantage teams with less tools saw. Teams able to pocket out their drive rails can save a good portion of weight on an already heavy swerve drivetrain.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T01:19:42.153Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":627,"readers_count":626,"score":130.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Dominick Ferone","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19411,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 "},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/13","custom_user_title":"353/358 Mentor - Formerly 5030/9016 ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500339,"name":"Jsteel","username":"Jsteel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9de053/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T01:33:59.325Z","cooked":"

In my opinion, from my ten plus years of experience- this change was five pounds too much. Need to go to 120 pounds in the future. I understand all the why’s, just disappointed we went down ten pounds instead of five and see what happens.

Yes, lots of complaints and a few real issues last year with collisions and damage, but we swung the pendulum too far the other way. We reinforced the field (good thing), changed bumper rules (good thing), made a boring to watch low collision game (not a good thing), and lowered robot weight by ten pounds (too far). In total, and overreaction to a problem that most had already solved at the end of last year.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T01:34:33.035Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":604,"readers_count":603,"score":235.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Jsteel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24050,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500388,"name":"Ryan Swanson","username":"Ryan_Swanson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_swanson/{size}/171065_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T02:27:54.407Z","cooked":"
Jsteel:

In my opinion, from my ten plus years of experience- this change was five pounds too much

I like the change. I’ll never be the person who says FRC is too easy… but I do like when teams are forced to make design tradeoffs. The brushless era with 125lb weight limit has made “playing the whole game” the default plan for most teams.

The top teams will still do everything well. The rest of us now need to carefully consider how we limit our scope in order to optimize our performance. It makes the build season more interesting in my opinion, especially in the open build era where great design solutions are documented and readily available for all to use.

The 115lb weight limit will sneak up on teams who aren’t planning for it this season. That will lead to some “feels bad” moments at competitions which is a bad thing… but on the whole I like the change and wouldn’t hate FIRST going even further with weight restrictions in future seasons.

Ryan_Swanson:

The 115lb weight limit will sneak up on teams who aren’t planning for it this season

This is what prompted some extra scrutiny for my team this season already. We finished our Engineering Build yesterday and found ourselves a few pounds overweight, and are now trading how to eliminate that plus get some margin back. Glad to find us in this position Feb 2nd rather than the week before week 1 comp. Anyway, I see a lot of little metal triangles in my future

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T02:33:55.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":534,"readers_count":533,"score":196.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3501470,"name":"Jake Potter","username":"Ninja_Bait","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ninja_bait/{size}/122409_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T05:30:41.869Z","cooked":"

Because a lot of events used Nexus, we had a good database of robot weights last year to look at in discussions of robot impacts. 115 is around where I thought the weight limit could be based on that data, balancing the increased design challenge to the teams against the efficiency of modern parts and need for improved crash safety. (Although I thought the bumper weight could remain the same for a total of 130 lbs. I guess you can be happy I’m not in charge of the rules!)

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T05:30:41.869Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":449,"readers_count":448,"score":104.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484831,"topic_slug":"why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025","display_username":"Jake Potter","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14418,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1554 Mentor, 694 Alum, LRI, FIRST Long Island RPC"},"post_url":"/t/why-was-the-robot-weight-limit-changed-in-2025/484831/17","custom_user_title":"1554 Mentor, 694 Alum, LRI, FIRST Long Island RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3501477,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T05:43:09.318Z","cooked":"

Pocketing out the drivetrain is severely disadvantageous due to weaking the frame rails. If you need weight that badly, 1/16th tube exists and doesn’t introduce a bunch of stress risers which will weaken the tube to below 1/16th levels of strength. And for that matter, pocketing is overrated when it comes to saving weight. Yea it can save a pound or two, but the first, easiest, cheapest, and most effective way to save weight is to just use less stuff. Even when maintaining the exact same functionality, a lot of unnecessary material can be cut out or the materials can be used more efficiently to avoid bending loads opposed to just throwing more material at the problem. This can easily save high single or double digit pounds for about as free as you can get.

On a different note, the most few recent games have favored lighter robots and smaller, compared to 2019 (the first introduction of the 125lb weight limit) where many teams had an extremely heavy climber in addition to a heavy elevator, or 2020, where teams needed large indexers, and a separate climber. This year, many teams are still running the heavy elevator, but a significantly less heavy climber, and running a dt significantly below maximum dimensions is advantageous if size was the only factor, but also saves quite a lot of weight.

The 115lb weight limit will sneak up on teams
